page.title: 03Housing in W. Buckfastleigh
page.content:
Various types of housing were found in the area. The village of Scorriton consists largely of stone-built cottages, but there are also about 20 council houses, a farmhouse, and a popular inn, the{"Tradesman's Arms". Michelcombe has several old cottages, some of which date from the 15th century. One of the cottages is let as holiday accommodation, and planning permission has recently been granted for the conversion of a barn for holiday use.
Of the larger properties, Brook House is still occupied as one dwelling, but Hawson Court is divided into three: the stable block is also separately owned and used as racing stables.
